channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Generative AI for Banks: Benchmarks and Algorithms for Synthetic Financial Transaction Data
item.description: The banking sector faces challenges in using deep learning due to data sensitivity and regulatory constraints, but generative AI may offer a solution.

item.title: Stack Trace Deduplication: Faster, More Accurately, and in More Realistic Scenarios
item.description: Our model consists of two parts - (1) an embedding model with byte-pair encoding and approximate nearest neighbor search to quickly find the most relevant stack traces to the incoming one, and (2) a reranker that re-ranks the most fitting stack traces, taking into account the repeated frames between them.

item.title: DiffSim: Taming Diffusion Models for Evaluating Visual Similarity
item.description: Diffusion models have fundamentally transformed the field of generative models, making the assessment of similarity between customized model outputs and reference inputs critically important.

item.title: TOMG-Bench: Evaluating LLMs on Text-based Open Molecule Generation
item.description: In this paper, we propose Text-based Open Molecule Generation Benchmark (TOMG-Bench), the first benchmark to evaluate the open-domain molecule generation capability of LLMs.

item.title: FlowAR: Scale-wise Autoregressive Image Generation Meets Flow Matching
item.description: Recently, in image generation, VAR proposes scale-wise autoregressive modeling, which extends the next token prediction to the next scale prediction, preserving the 2D structure of images.

item.title: ReMoE: Fully Differentiable Mixture-of-Experts with ReLU Routing
item.description: Sparsely activated Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) models are widely adopted to scale up model capacity without increasing the computation budget.

item.title: Downscaling Precipitation with Bias-informed Conditional Diffusion Model
item.description: In this work, we introduce a bias-informed conditional diffusion model for statistical downscaling of precipitation.

item.title: Consistent Human Image and Video Generation with Spatially Conditioned Diffusion
item.description: By fine-tuning existing base diffusion models on human video data, our method demonstrates strong generalization to unseen human identities and poses without requiring additional per-instance fine-tuning.

item.title: Automatic Spectral Calibration of Hyperspectral Images:Method, Dataset and Benchmark
item.description: Usually, HSI needs to be calibrated to minimize the impact of various illumination conditions.

item.title: Generalizing Constraint Models in Constraint Acquisition
item.description: In this paper, we address this limitation by proposing GenCon, a novel approach to learn parameterized constraint models capable of modeling varying instances of the same problem.

item.title: Preventing Local Pitfalls in Vector Quantization via Optimal Transport
item.description: Vector-quantized networks (VQNs) have exhibited remarkable performance across various tasks, yet they are prone to training instability, which complicates the training process due to the necessity for techniques such as subtle initialization and model distillation.

item.title: PC-BEV: An Efficient Polar-Cartesian BEV Fusion Framework for LiDAR Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Extensive evaluation on the SemanticKITTI and nuScenes datasets provides compelling evidence that our method outperforms previous multiview fusion approaches in terms of both performance and inference speed, highlighting the potential of BEV-based fusion for LiDAR segmentation.

item.title: DS$^2$-ABSA: Dual-Stream Data Synthesis with Label Refinement for Few-Shot Aspect-Based Sentiment Analysis
item.description: In few-shot aspect-based sentiment analysis (ABSA), previous efforts have explored data augmentation techniques, which prompt LLMs to generate new samples by modifying existing ones.

item.title: Unveiling Uncertainty: A Deep Dive into Calibration and Performance of Multimodal Large Language Models
item.description: This paper investigates representative MLLMs, focusing on their calibration across various scenarios, including before and after visual fine-tuning, as well as before and after multimodal training of the base LLMs.

item.title: Head and Neck Tumor Segmentation of MRI from Pre- and Mid-radiotherapy with Pre-training, Data Augmentation and Dual Flow UNet
item.description: Head and neck tumors and metastatic lymph nodes are crucial for treatment planning and prognostic analysis.

item.title: Associative memory inspires improvements for in-context learning using a novel attention residual stream architecture
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) demonstrate an impressive ability to utilise information within the context of their input sequences to appropriately respond to data unseen by the LLM during its training procedure.

item.title: ORBIT: Cost-Effective Dataset Curation for Large Language Model Domain Adaptation with an Astronomy Case Study
item.description: Recent advances in language modeling demonstrate the need for high-quality domain-specific training data, especially for tasks that require specialized knowledge.

item.title: RobustFT: Robust Supervised Fine-tuning for Large Language Models under Noisy Response
item.description: Supervised fine-tuning (SFT) plays a crucial role in adapting large language models (LLMs) to specific domains or tasks.

item.title: Graph-Structured Topic Modeling for Documents with Spatial or Covariate Dependencies
item.description: We address the challenge of incorporating document-level metadata into topic modeling to improve topic mixture estimation.

item.title: Agent-SafetyBench: Evaluating the Safety of LLM Agents
item.description: However, the absence of comprehensive benchmarks for evaluating agent safety presents a significant barrier to effective assessment and further improvement.

item.title: Cal-DPO: Calibrated Direct Preference Optimization for Language Model Alignment
item.description: Contrastive preference optimization has shown promising results in aligning LLMs with available preference data by optimizing the implicit reward associated with the policy.

item.title: Sliding Windows Are Not the End: Exploring Full Ranking with Long-Context Large Language Models
item.description: Furthermore, we identify two limitations of fine-tuning the full ranking model based on existing methods: (1) sliding window strategy fails to produce a full ranking list as a training label, and (2) the language modeling loss cannot emphasize top-ranked passage IDs in the label.

item.title: PA-RAG: RAG Alignment via Multi-Perspective Preference Optimization
item.description: The emergence of Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) has alleviated the issues of outdated and hallucinatory content in the generation of large language models (LLMs), yet it still reveals numerous limitations.

item.title: CLDG: Contrastive Learning on Dynamic Graphs
item.description: The graph with complex annotations is the most potent data type, whose constantly evolving motivates further exploration of the unsupervised dynamic graph representation.

item.title: PsyDraw: A Multi-Agent Multimodal System for Mental Health Screening in Left-Behind Children
item.description: Left-behind children (LBCs), numbering over 66 million in China, face severe mental health challenges due to parental migration for work.

item.title: Pitfalls of topology-aware image segmentation
item.description: Topological correctness, i. e., the preservation of structural integrity and specific characteristics of shape, is a fundamental requirement for medical imaging tasks, such as neuron or vessel segmentation.

item.title: FROC: Building Fair ROC from a Trained Classifier
item.description: With the proposed query model, we provide a rigorous theoretical analysis of the minimal AUC loss to achieve $\varepsilon_1$-Equalized ROC.

item.title: Entropy Regularized Task Representation Learning for Offline Meta-Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Context-based approaches utilize a history of state-action-reward transitions -- referred to as the context -- to infer representations of the current task, and then condition the agent, i. e., the policy and value function, on the task representations.

item.title: Prototypical Calibrating Ambiguous Samples for Micro-Action Recognition
item.description: In addition, we propose a new prototypical diversity amplification loss to strengthen the model's capacity by amplifying the differences between different prototypes.

item.title: Promptable Representation Distribution Learning and Data Augmentation for Gigapixel Histopathology WSI Analysis
item.description: Gigapixel image analysis, particularly for whole slide images (WSIs), often relies on multiple instance learning (MIL).

item.title: Efficient Self-Supervised Video Hashing with Selective State Spaces
item.description: We introduce S5VH, a Mamba-based video hashing model with an improved self-supervised learning paradigm.

item.title: Alignment-Free RGB-T Salient Object Detection: A Large-scale Dataset and Progressive Correlation Network
item.description: Alignment-free RGB-Thermal (RGB-T) salient object detection (SOD) aims to achieve robust performance in complex scenes by directly leveraging the complementary information from unaligned visible-thermal image pairs, without requiring manual alignment.

item.title: Affordance-Aware Object Insertion via Mask-Aware Dual Diffusion
item.description: As a common image editing operation, image composition involves integrating foreground objects into background scenes.

item.title: Multi-Sensor Object Anomaly Detection: Unifying Appearance, Geometry, and Internal Properties
item.description: Object anomaly detection is essential for industrial quality inspection, yet traditional single-sensor methods face critical limitations.

item.title: Face the Facts! Evaluating RAG-based Fact-checking Pipelines in Realistic Settings
item.description: Natural Language Processing and Generation systems have recently shown the potential to complement and streamline the costly and time-consuming job of professional fact-checkers.

item.title: LeviTor: 3D Trajectory Oriented Image-to-Video Synthesis
item.description: The intuitive nature of drag-based interaction has led to its growing adoption for controlling object trajectories in image-to-video synthesis.

item.title: Knowledge Distillation in RNN-Attention Models for Early Prediction of Student Performance
item.description: Early prediction for identifying at-risk students is a crucial and widely researched topic in EDM research.

item.title: DCTdiff: Intriguing Properties of Image Generative Modeling in the DCT Space
item.description: The effectiveness of DCTdiff and the introduced properties suggest a promising direction for image modeling in the frequency space.

item.title: On the Use of Deep Learning Models for Semantic Clone Detection
item.description: Several deep learning-based clone detection models have appeared in the literature for detecting syntactic and semantic clones, widely evaluated with the BigCloneBench dataset.

item.title: TDCNet: Transparent Objects Depth Completion with CNN-Transformer Dual-Branch Parallel Network
item.description: The sensing and manipulation of transparent objects present a critical challenge in industrial and laboratory robotics.

item.title: Unified Image Restoration and Enhancement: Degradation Calibrated Cycle Reconstruction Diffusion Model
item.description: Image restoration and enhancement are pivotal for numerous computer vision applications, yet unifying these tasks efficiently remains a significant challenge.

item.title: Prompt-A-Video: Prompt Your Video Diffusion Model via Preference-Aligned LLM
item.description: Text-to-video models have made remarkable advancements through optimization on high-quality text-video pairs, where the textual prompts play a pivotal role in determining quality of output videos.

item.title: ClusterTalk: Corpus Exploration Framework using Multi-Dimensional Exploratory Search
item.description: Exploratory search of large text corpora is essential in domains like biomedical research, where large amounts of research literature are continuously generated.

item.title: Lorentzian Residual Neural Networks
item.description: Hyperbolic neural networks have emerged as a powerful tool for modeling hierarchical data structures prevalent in real-world datasets.

item.title: PhotoHolmes: a Python library for forgery detection in digital images
item.description: In this paper, we introduce PhotoHolmes, an open-source Python library designed to easily run and benchmark forgery detection methods on digital images.

item.title: CAE-T: A Channelwise AutoEncoder with Transformer for EEG Abnormality Detection
item.description: Electroencephalogram (EEG) signals are critical for detecting abnormal brain activity, but their high dimensionality and complexity pose significant challenges for effective analysis.

item.title: Cirbo: A New Tool for Boolean Circuit Analysis and Synthesis
item.description: We present an open-source tool for manipulating Boolean circuits.

item.title: ResoFilter: Rine-grained Synthetic Data Filtering for Large Language Models through Data-Parameter Resonance Analysis
item.description: To address these challenges, we propose ResoFilter, a novel method that integrates models, data, and tasks to refine datasets.

item.title: RefHCM: A Unified Model for Referring Perceptions in Human-Centric Scenarios
item.description: Human-centric perceptions play a crucial role in real-world applications.

item.title: Successive optimization of optics and post-processing with differentiable coherent PSF operator and field information
item.description: This joint optimization pipeline offers innovative insights into the practical design of sophisticated optical systems and post-processing algorithms.
